titleStmt.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to John L. Cadwalader, December 31, 1875

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Despatch from J. Milton Turner to John L. Cadwalader
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States
Republic of Liberia

J Milton Turner
to the>
Department of State
Washington U.S.A.
Transmitting report of U.S. Commercial Agent at Grand Bassa Liberia.

Inclosures No. 1. Despatch from Mr Crusoe.
" " 2. Statement showing the Commerce of Grand Bassa during the year ending September 30th 1875

Consulate General of the United States
Monrovia Liberia December 31st 1875
I have the honor to transmit herewith the statement showing the Commerce of Grand Bassa for the year ending September the 30; as furnished me by the United States Commercial Agent at that point.

I have the honor to be
Sir/
Your obedient servant
J Milton Turner
div1.fw:
Honorable
John L. Cadwalader
Ast. Secretary of State
Washington U.S.A.

div1.p:
U.S. Comercial Agency at
Grand Bassa, Decbr. 25, 1875.

Hon. J. M. Turner.
U.S.M.R. and Con. Genl.
Republic of Liberia.

I have the honor to enclose herewith, statement showing the Commerce of Grand Bassa during the years ending Septr. 30, 1875. In respect to which beg to remark that it is as complete as the facilities at my command enabled me to make it.

I have the honor to remain
Sir
Your obedient humble servant
(sd) H. L. Crusoe
U.S. Com. Agt.
